values: Go back to school and to buy my own place.

Balut... aka boiled eggs with the chick or duck embryos cooked inside, the idea of eating them makes me want to gag and it disgusts me to find them inside. I also don't get how balut is labeled an aphrodisiac.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/15384.html

I would definitely use the money to go back to school to study art, which is #1 on my list.

#2 is to use the money to renovate my home and replace the outdated electric and plumbing fixtures.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/15321.html

Firstly, I would definitely want to change my dad's bad ways of handling his money because he NEVER thinks about his actions and consequences first before he starts spending.

Second, I wished my parents (as well as my aunt) would stop blaming me when I get bullied in high school, saying that I "started" the trouble; same with my shitty school counselors. I can't believe why it took them YEARS to realize that being bullied is NOT the victim's fault.

Although I learned from my mistakes since I did some stupid things when I was young, but I also wished I hadn't done them. Xo( Why? I can't tell you the number of times my parents and aunt were constantly shoving those incidences down my throat. For instance, when I was 15, I got fired from my first job, but my parents and aunt won't stop talking about that incident despite not happening again and I learned from my mistake. I even told them that it was irritating and embarrassing, but they didn't listen. Look at them, my brother did worse things, but did they ever shoved them down his throat? No.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/14876.html

Firstly, I would replace a lot of obsolete and outdated fixtures, appliances, and shitty tile and carpeting. Then get rid of my dad's useless junk he hoards, no matter how mad he gets (believe me, negotiating with him is like talking to a brick wall.)

As for style, mine would be zen contemporary because my family would like to come home and feel relaxed after hard days of work. My home would also have lots of storage and shelving units, plus a home studio I would like to have to house my arts and crafts. I would also like to have some kind of built-in stereo system where I could plug in my iPod so I could listen to music while relaxing in my new studio.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/14686.html

For me, I regretted saying or doing stupid things IRL and/or online and wish I hadn't. Despite the regrets, I learned from those mistakes so it won't happen again.

Sad thing is sometimes friends or family didn't want to let go of those and often bring those embarrassing things up. Sure, I may do some idiotic things and learn from those mistakes, but really, do they have to shove them down my throat numerous times? Xo(
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/14440.html

I can take criticism well, especially if it involves on improvement. They helped me look at my mistakes or help me change on things. As an artist, I asked my friends to take a look at my work and tell me what to improve on.

Sometimes there are people who don't know how to do constructive criticism, so their lines often fall on "You're stupid" or "Ha! Ha! You suck!"
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/14235.html

I've yet to meet a movie or TV star IRL, but I did met a few celebrity chefs while visiting the EAT! Vancouver event every year. It's good to see them, but I think it's better to treat celebrities with respect and privacy.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/13958.html

For me, it's art.

I am always never satisfied anyday without ever creating art. I constantly have tons of ideas swirling in my head and waiting to get out, so I had to grab myself a pencil and paper and immediately started doodling. Same goes with crafting since I like working with my hands.

I do share my interests and hobbies on the internet, not just LiveJournal because I like to meet other people with the same things. I find myself to be more chatty online than offline.

I too am trying to reconnect with long-lost friends both online and in real life. In fact, some of them I didn't expect to come across again. I've met some old elementary and high school classmates through the 'net expectedly and asked me if I remember them. LOL
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/13099.html

Don't listen to your aunt's bad rantings about you. She wanted you to please her.

Don't give in when your dad asks for money. It's because of him that got us into debt into the first place.

I am a chocoholic, so not surprisingly I LOVE any chocolate desserts. (Well, with some exceptions since I always hated those with raisins.)

When I was in high school (in 1992), I was using the crosswalk, along with other classmates. A car screeched to a halt because the driver did not see a bunch of students crossing the street. While walking pass the car, another one crashed into it, causing the car to move forward towards me and some classmates. It missed us by millimeters.

Obviously, it's art. I LOVE to draw and create things using my own hands, but right now I am still saving up money to go back to school.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/12094.html
First and foremost, I would use the money to go back to school and then buy my mom a new house.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/11884.html

I have a lot of pet peeves. Here's a few:

1.) People who said they'll do something when being told, but didn't. My brother is a good example of this. Whenever he was told to do a chore, he constantly says "I WILL!!" Guess what, he didn't move his lazy ass to do the chore.

2.) Bullies ('nuff said) I HATE it when people bully others just to be "cool" as well as to impress their so-called "friends."

3.) Narrow-minded people/people who think they're ALWAYS right, but aren't. My dad is an example of this.

4.) Fantards; People who get WAY TOO obsessive in their fandom. They often made a HUGE deal about the little things about their favorite character from shipping to hatred of a character.

5.) People who call others stupid when they couldn't communicate in the same language. If you worked customer service, you may know what I mean. While we can understand that the person couldn't speak English, he or she shouldn't call others stupid when we're doing our best to help them.

That's all, folks!
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/11652.html
I prefer to live by the ocean. It's my dream ever since I was a little girl.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/11312.html

The bad: how people could easily get information and pass any false rumors about it. Children could also easily get access to inappropriate material and cheating on their homework by plagarizing. MMORPG

You may find it hard to believe that my classmates in my former elementary school called me Luigi because I was crazy about the Super Mario games.

I was also called Louie, (even though I am a girl, but was short for Lowena) by my former co-workers at A&W before I quit months ago.

Maggots!!

Seeing these things crawling around in rotting flesh, dead bodies, or garbage make me cringe with disgust. That's why I am not cut out to be a forensic technician despite my interests; You must have a strong stomach to deal with them.

I am also downright scared of spiders as well.

My dad. He always NEVER thinks first before doing anything with money and as a result pisses me, my mom, and my brother off. He too borrows money from other people and didn't return them.

Just a few days ago, he did it again. Once again, I received a call from Money Mart concerning his finances.

I would definitely wanted to be famous for my artwork, animated or illustrated. ;)
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/9034.html

What's keeping me away from my dream job? Mostly money. I don't have enough to go to school where I can get training as an animator and I had to thank my dad for that. >:( Thanks to the debts he was constantly piling up, I don't have enough money.

Second is family disapproval and my aunt is to blame. After I made the decision that I wanted to be an animator or artist, that doesn't sit too well with my family, especially my aunt. She wanted me to go to university just because SHE goes to university, so she often pressured me too much for that. Yet she NEVER did the same with my younger brother. Sadly though, it took her YEARS to realize that I wanted to be an animator NOT go to university and be a stupid clone of her.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/8760.html

Over the years, he constantly NEVER thinks first before doing something with them. If he was MORE smarter and listened to family a lot more, then we shouldn't have gotten into debt into the first place.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/8602.html

For me, I am sometimes the breadwinner and one whom my parents relied TOO MUCH on (with the English translations that is.) My dad and my brother constantly acted like lazy buttheads at home. My dad always acts foolish with money, while my brother still acted like a total brat.

I just HATE translating for my Dad because he always loses his temper when I explained to him in Chinese. One time I had to explain that he doesn't have to worry about the credit part on the gas bill, but NO he had to get mad about it even when customer service told him over the phone. (No one there can speak Chinese, which sucked.)

Sometimes I do get jealous when some of my friends get well known by other people and not be shy about it. I felt really ignored, yet angry.

With artists, I also get jealous when other people chose my friends' pictures over mine, despite being a good artist too. It made me feel that I am NOT good enough. Sometimes I do want them to introduce me to others, but no... I feel so crushed!
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/7964.html

I stopped working at A&W since November and I don't miss that place at all. While I do like being in charge, but dealing with a whole shitload of rude entitled customers made me all stressed out. Same goes with the management.

What I'll miss:

  • working with co-workers I like
  • giving treats to dogs in Drive-Thru
  • working in the kitchen and making food
  • meeting and talking with regular customers

What I won't miss:

  • rude, entitled customers
  • terrible management
  • the unpredictable time schedule (I constantly kept requesting to work mornings, but NOOO!!!)
  • the restaurant owner's daughter (GOD!! I hate her!)
  • finding nasty surprises in the washrooms >_<
  • drunks and crackheads that came in during the evenings
  • working evenings and having had to stay late because I am a supervisor
  • rude and rowdy teenagers
  • having had to close at 11 PM and then wake up a few hours later to open at 7 AM (8-hour interval law my ASS!!!)
For the last part, I cannot believe managers were allowed to have 8-hour intervals between schedules. Legal or not, I still find it ridiculous! Haven't they realize how many hours of sleep the employees would have between that?

Screw you, A&W!!! I am NOT going to work in fast food resturants again.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/7896.html

<lj-template name="qotd" id="326"></lj-template>Well, I am quite ashamed of being whiny over the littlest things as well as having an uppity ego. Sometimes I do get jealous of other people and made a huge deal about it.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/7434.html

Just checked into my Inbox this morning and I've just received an email about my artwork from a "Lowenah." At first, I thought it was a total joke, but it wasn't. She told me that she wasn't the only person with a bizarrely-spelled name. (BTW the name is more commonly spelled with an "R." Mine is spelled with an "L" because my parents had trouble pronouncing the R.) Coincidentally, at the A&W where I worked, a former supervisor had the same name as me. 

I can't believe I've found another Lowena/Rowena! Not a common name though.

Speaking of A&W, I've already sent my resume to various admin-type positions, including Tourism Vancouver and a few police departments. I am so desperate to quit that place since the management had totally went downhill since my old manager was on medical leave. The new manager drove me up the wall because he short-staffed both the day and evening shifts and NEVER bothered to hire more people to help us. Haven't he known that the Christmas holidays are the most stressful times? The other supervisors and I complained about it and he had done nothing about it!! ARGH!!!
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/7201.html

Just got this figure days ago when I have a stat holiday at A&W. It is one of those special action figures that enabled artists like me to use them as references. This little 12-inch figure are sold under the name of Art S. Bucks and it worked the same way as a wooden mannekin only better. I had to say it help me a lot with poses; better than using refenence photos.



It's $35.00 CDN from an art supply store I went to. Bit more expensive than the wooden mannekins, but worth it because this figure have more articulation allowing us to adjust them in various poses. I know we can do the same with other action figures, but I thought having a model like this would give me more of a blank canvas. This figure is available in both genders as well as in the style of Caucasians and African-American.

Having a day off at work made me tell good. ^_^ I might get myself a male version later on since I need a little help drawing males.

Anyway, I was pretty excited to see the release of Yoshi's Island DS and it made me want to get myself a Nintendo DS. From what I see from the screenshots, it's a good thing it's not like the upsetting Yoshi's Story for the Nintendo 64 years before. Ugh! Seeing that new game made me want to draw babies of various video game and anime characters!!
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/6912.html

I walked into a Chapters (which is the Canadian version of Barnes&Noble) in downtown Vancouver and I've just came across a magazine that features some bizzare fetishes. Since it featured some Japanese stuff, I decided to look through it, but sadly, my curiousity got the best of me. I looked into the section that featured the adult side of anime and I just seen some really disturbing hentai art which totally traumatized me. The one I am talking about is something called guro or gore, which is sort of like a serial killer's work of art. There was even a manga version of vore, which like in furry art have some anime characters eat one another. Believe it or not, I got nightmares after I saw them.

I may be used to looking at or drawing porn/hentai, but there are some disturbing stuff like that which really makes my eyes burn. No wonder some people got the wrong ideas about both anime and furry fans.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/6811.html

Yesterday morning, I've just been told that the A&W where I worked was part of the reality show The Amazing Race. I thought everyone was kidding, but they weren't. The VERY first contestant that came had a camera installed at the front of the car. I don't remember the clue that they were looking for, but I think it's better to find out when the episode aired. Man, I wished I could see the panic those contestants were going through when they all lined up at the drive-thru. BTW you should see how the Assistant Manager reacted to this though; it was hilarious!!

Sadly, I wasn't working the morning shift. It would be pretty exciting for me to be on television. X^)

I remembered seeing the envelope labeled "The Amazing Race" in the office a few times. For the whole time I thought it was some sort of game my manager was playing, but I NEVER knew it was the real thing.

Well, it's a little term I made up. I just come up with that since I enjoyed both furry and anime (and I just discovered that I am not the only one.) Perfect for fans who were caught in the middle of the furry and anime fandom.

Last Saturday was a major setback at the A&W where I worked. We were totally understaffed because two of the cooks didn't show up for their shifts, one already quit and the other one is leaving soon but chose not to show up. It wasn't too bad though because it wasn't too busy for a Saturday. Funny thing is I had to work in the kitchen all evening (because one of the current cooks is still in training) and had forgotten that I had a hairnet on. So, whenever I helped a customer at the front I had this strange thing holding back my long hair and nobody even said anything bout it.

However, I am glad one of those cooks is leaving soon because I don't like her.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/5776.html

Yesterday, some asshole walked into the A&W where I worked and started complaining to the assistant manager. From the way he gestured and how he spoke, I know he sounded like trouble. In fact, his stature and his threatening manner scared the shit out of me and my two other co-workers (both girls) who were working at the front. From what I heard, he falsely accused one staff member from the morning shift of "sabotaging" his food. He even asked the assistant manager when was that particular co-worker of mine is working since he wanted to "beat the shit" out of him. (Of course, he refused to give out confidential information about his employees.) Seeing that me and the other girls looking very scared, the asshole asked the AM to talk in private. After he left, we asked the AM what was going on and he mentioned that he had no idea what he was talking about since the asshole mentioned that the food he was given gave him indigestion or something.

I had no idea if that asshole was trying to scam us into giving him free food or was he looking for someone to beat up. No matter what it is, I know it wasn't my co-worker or anyone else who "sabotaged" his food. I think the asshole must be high on something and got indigestion as a result. Man, I can tell you he's trouble.

In case you're wondering, yes, I am going to talk to my manager about it. I am pretty concerned for my co-worker's safety and praying he isn't coming back.

That's it I am looking for a new job! Once I found one I am going to quit once and for all!!

After I had left my workplace at the office, I decided to try out some tasty wraps at Steamrollers. Ordering a wet burrito called "The Tommy," I can't believe I enjoyed the stuff, but after looking at my watch I had to leave. Without ever taking a breather, I took the bus and nearly threw up. Man, next time I had to rest first after I ate something.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/4821.html

Yep, my manager had promoted me to supervisor last Friday. Ever since I was promoted I am determined not to make the same mistake as one of my last ones.

You see that girl used to be a hard worker long before she was promoted. After she became supervisor, she started slacking off and disappear for a period of time where she was needed the most. She even left people to "fend for themselves" and often left the workplace without telling anyone where she was going. At this one time, the drive-thru had gotten so busy that I had to call that girl for help. As it turned out she was nowhere to be found, leaving me and the only available cook working alone. After a while she showed up with a bunch of grocery bags and it turned out that she had left the place. (Man, I was mad at her too.) Because supervisors and managers get free food, she constantly gave them to her family and friends (which is, of course, against the rules.) A year as a supervisor passed and then she quit after being engaged to her boyfriend. Many people were really glad to see her go because she is SO freaking lazy!!

I haven't heard from that girl for a long time, but I've been told that she still refused to find a job after getting married. Serves her right.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/4396.html

In one of my old journal entries, I've mentioned that I might be promoted to supervisor at the fast food joint where I worked. Guess what? It's a lie, a total lie.  My manager said that I am going to be supervisor from her own mouth, but as it turned out it's a lie. I was trained to do the managerial stuff, but no.

Worst still, that manager of mine had to promote the wrong people. At one time this girl was promoted to supervisor after working for ONLY 3 MONTHS!! Why? Because the manager liked her, but that was a HUGE mistake. Many of the employees hated her and many of them quit, including another supervisor. She even abused her position by becoming more arrogant and bossy. In fact, many of my co-workers prefer to have me as supervisor over her because I am less bossy and nicer too. The question is why didn't the manger promote me. It's because she doesn't like me at all despite putting a lot of trust into me.

In case you're wondering, I am actively finding myself another job. Once it's done, I am going to quit that fast food joint once and for all! I hate my manager; she's so unethical and worst than the last.

At least that girl quit after being demoted because she really deserved it after making a huge mistake after another.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/4265.html

I checked out the Health and Wellness Show last Friday due to my curiousity as well as my interests in staying healthy. It's pretty interesting even though some of the products displayed are pretty strange, especially the food I had sampled. Many people think health food tastes gross, but they're not because they were done right. However, one of the strangest I've tried is a beverage made out of marine phytoplankton which the representatives claimed had lowered the risk of cancer. ICK!! That stuff tasted like cough syrup!! Another product I've tried are sour cream and cream cheese made out of tofu and believe it or not they taste good. They were totally like the real thing that you may find it hard to believe it was made from soy products. For vegans and people who are lactose intolerant, this is prefect for them.

I did receive a bag full of samples of teas, chips, and medicine (for headaches and stomach problems), but one sample that really shocked me was a jar of shark cartilage capsules. o_O People have told me that these have some health benefits, but I am totally weary of something like this since there are no scientific proof about them.

My mom had just returned from her trip in Hong Kong and man, my relatives had bought me tons of stuff for me, including a brand-new cellphone. Because there are tons of new clothes, my brother and I had to get rid of our old ones. I've already placed many of mine in bags, but I had to ask my brother before I could call the Salvation Army for a pick-up. (I am hoping my mom won't make a huge fuss like before since these are my clothing, not hers.) As for the new cellphone, I had to purchase myself a new SIM card as well as signing up for service before using. It even got a built-in camera so I can take pictures and download on my bro's laptop. Because of all those features, I am going to download some stuff to personalize my cellphone from a Naruto wallpaper to a ringtone that plays the Candy Shop song. ^^

I even got tons of new purses as well as a new backpack. The new backpack had some of my aunt's accessories and I had to remove them just to add my personal touches to it. Looked like it's time to purchase some keychains and strapped dolls for myself. ^^ I wonder if my friend Stefan could help me with that since I wanted to get some Capcom-related merchandise.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/3998.html

Yeah, I know it's a little late because of my stupid work schedule. I hope the Chinese New Year is good for everyone here. From what I've read so far, romance is good for Snake people such as me and more success in money is coming my way. I may not be superstitous like my parents and relatives, but they had to make me and my brother keep up with tradition. 

For instance, the house had to be cleaned before the lunar new year started because if people sweep the house during that time their luck and fortune would be taken away. Of course I was shocked at first after hearing about why shouldn't we clean the house during the first few days Chinese New Year. Also it is considered unlucky to say something bad about family members. Don't ask, there are stories associated with those traditions. Like the western society who consider the number 13 to be unlucky, Asians considered the number 4 to be bad because it almost sounded like "death."

Sadly, my mom won't be returning from her trip in Hong Kong until Sunday. She originally supposed to come back on January 25th, but due to some uncertain circumstances she had to delay the return trip for (almost) two weeks.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/3708.html

Not easy being a fan of anthro and anime art. I draw them both and enjoyed them both, but still there are some stuff from both sides that totally annoyed me. Sometimes the fans do get at each other's throats too. I also hated taking sides when it comes to flame wars like this.

There are lots of designer/crossbred poodles these days like the Multi-poo (Maltese/Poodle), Labradoodle (Lab/Poodle), and Schoodle (Schnauzer/Poodle.) Now there's a breed where a Shih Tzu was crossed with a poodle and thus some people called it a Shitty-Poo!! I actually don't like the name, but it sounds funny nonetheless. Sad thing is that breeders tried not to put Shitty-Poo in the classifieds without offending readers.

Remember the joke about crossing a Bulldog with a Shih Tzu? I don't know if it's been done in real life, but I'll laugh if some idiot posted "Bullshit for Sale!!"

Makes me wonder why the breed was called Shih Tzu in the first place.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/3084.html

You're NOT going to believe what had happened when I was going to work on Saturday. As I walked into the fast food joint, I saw tons of dirty water and grease on the floor. Shocked, I asked what was going on after I saw the sign saying that the place was closed.

Alexis, one of my co-workers, told me that the pipes in the washrooms were busted and had flooded the entire resturant thus putting them in ankle deep water. Fortunately, they managed to stop most of the shit in the water from going into the kitchen. Even the entire kitchen floor was covered with grease. Worst still, that event happened in front of our regional manager. We had to close the lobby first, but keep the drive-thru open (as mentioned by the restaurant owner who was there.) Of course, my co-workers don't like the idea of that since we cannot serve food in unsanitary conditions like this. There the entire place had to close up until the pipes were fixed and the place cleaned up and sanitized.

I was thankful that I wasn't there when it happened, but I can see the aftermath and smelled the bleach too. I am just glad my co-workers closed the place for sanitary reasons. I can believe that restaurant owner is one freaking twat for keeping the place open despite all that. The problem with him is that he NEVER listens to his employees. He would ONLY get into action if customers and/or the health department complained to him.
http://china-kitty.livejournal.com/2915.html
